title: experimental typography
content:
this may come across as the most philistine of posts.. but [i dont care] :) :)

does anyone know of any experimental typefoundries??..

ie Emigre, t26, (fuse, DB??)

something that is a bit either avant garde.. totally misunderstood, generally bizarre, or just in a world of its own?

 [‹ Reprints of Sergei Chekhonin design work?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060228/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31588 "Go to previous forum topic") [My list of must have fonts... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060228/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31578 "Go to next forum topic")
author: oldelpaso

comments.content: [Pizzadude.dk](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060228/http:/www.pizzadude.dk/home.php) is willfully freeform, but it is in Indie Fonts 3, so maybe it’s not out there enough for you. As the creator, Jakob Fischer, says on the About page, “Don’t expect me do re-do Times New Roman or Futura!” That’s a far cry from a lot of type designers, who are always looking to create book types.

it’s not a foundry, but lots of experimental and fun things have happened for rick valicenti’s playground project. most of it isn’t downloadable anymore (it was all limited) but i’m sure you could contact the designers if you’re interested in playing with anything. ( [http://playplayplayplay.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060228/http:/playplayplayplay.com/ "http://playplayplayplay.com/"))

I have a few experimental fonts that are disitributed by Veer, you can see them all at:

[http://www.autodidakt.se](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060228/http:/www.autodidakt.se/ "http://www.autodidakt.se")
